docs.title: Welcome to the Castopod User Guide
docs.text:
Welcome to the Castopod user guide! This guide shows you how to set up your instance, import or create a podcast, and publish your podcast episodes using Castopod.

For developer documentation visit docs.castopod.org.

docs.title: What is Castopod?
docs.text: Castopod is an open source self-hosted podcast platform. Castopod allows you to engage and interact with your audience with its built-in social network connected to the Fediverse.

docs.title: Castopod Features
docs.text:
• Publish your episodes using RSS
  • Connect to Apple Podcasts, YouTube Music, Podcast Index and more using the built-in RSS feed.
  • Podcasting 2.0 features including transcripts, persons, locations, chapters, funding, and more.
  • Built-in social network connected to the Fediverse allowing you to create posts and comment on episodes. Mastodon users can follow your podcast, leave a comment, and like posts.
  • Built-in analytics that are GDPR / CCPA / LGPD compliant.
  • Import your existing podcast into Castopod.
  • Built-in marketing tools including SEO, soundbites, videoclips, and an embeddable player that can be used on any website.
  • Host unlimited podcasts.
  • Add additional users and assign them roles.
  • Monetize your podcast using funding links, listen-to-click ads, premium podcasts, and value4value.

docs.title: About the Castopod User Guide
docs.text:

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Congratulations on starting (or continuing) your podcasting journey using Castopod. This guide shows you how to get started by creating your first podcast in Castpod and publishing your first episode.

To get started, you will need podcast covert art and a recording.

docs.title: Create your first podcast in Castopod
Create your first podcast
docs.text: From the left hand navigation sidebar, press the + sign to the right of Podcasts to create your first podcast.

docs.title: Podcast Cover
docs.text: To upload your podcast cover art, press the Choose File button and choose your covert art from your computer. The cover art needs to be in JPG or PNG format and a minimum of 1400px wide and tall with a maximum of 3000px wide and tall.

docs.title: Title
docs.text: Enter the name of your podcast in the Title field.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Describe what your podcast is about. You can use Markdown to style the text and you can resize the text box by pressing and holding the bottom right hand corner of the text box.

docs.title: Type
docs.text: Choose how your listeners should listen to your podcast. Episodic lets listeners know they can consume your podcast in any order, such as an interview podcast. Choose Serial if your episodes are meant to be listened to in sequential order.

docs.title: Medium
docs.text:
Choose the type of audio for your podcast:

  • Podcast: a standard podcast.
  • Music: A feed of music organized into an "album" with each item a song within the album.
  • Audiobook: A specific type of audio with one item per feed, or where items represent chapters within a book.

docs.title: Language
docs.text: From the dropdown menu, choose which language is spoken in your podcast.

docs.title: Category
docs.text: Choose the category that represents your podcast, such as Arts, Comedy, Technology, etc.

docs.title: Other categories (optional)
docs.text: You can choose a second category in addition to the main category you set up.

docs.title: Parental advisory
docs.text: Choose if your podcast has explicit content or swearing or choose Clean if your podcast is suitable for everyone. You can also choose to leave this category as undefined.

docs.title: Owner name and email
docs.text: Enter the owner name and email in the provided fields. This is only visible in the RSS feed and is used by other podcasting platforms to verify your ownership of your podcast. You can choose to remove the owner email from the public RSS feed by using the provided toggle.

docs.title: Publisher
docs.text: If your podcast is part of a podcast network or is produced by a company, enter the publisher here.

docs.title: Copyright
docs.text: You can optionally add the copyright holder in this field.

docs.title: Fediverse identity
docs.text:
Enter the handle (or nickname) for your podcast. This will allow people on Mastodon and other Fediverse services to follow your podcast. Your handle will be shown as @handle@yourdomain.com on the Fediverse.

To learn more about Fediverse integration, visit the Fediverse documentation page.

docs.title: Podcast banner
docs.text: Upload a banner image to be displayed at the top of your podcast's home page. The banner must have a 3:1 ration and be at least 1500px wide.

docs.title: Premium
docs.text: Toggle this setting to set all episodes by default as premium. When creating an episode, it will default to premium, and you can still choose to make some episodes, trailers, or bonus content as free and public.

docs.title: Open Podcast Prefix Project (OP3)
docs.text: The Open Podcast Prefix Project is an open source and trusted third party analytics service. If you toggle this to enabled, you will be able to view analytics for your podcast over time including the number of listens over the first 7 days, 30 days, and more.

docs.title: Location
docs.text: You can optionally add a real or fictitious location name in this field.

docs.title: Advanced Parameters
docs.text: You can optinally toggle the following settings: * Prevent podcast from being copied: this locks your podcast and does not allow other podcast platforms to import your podcast. If you decide in the future to migrate away from Castopod to a new platform, this toggle will need to be unchecked. * Podcast should be hidden from public catalogues: If toggled, a best effort is made to hide the entire podcast from appearing in Apple Podcasts, YouTube Music, and any other third party podcast apps. (Not guaranteed) * Podcast will not be having new episodes: If your podcast comes to an end, you can toggle this to let listeners know there will not be new episodes.

docs.title: Installing Castopod
docs.text: Please visit the official Castopod documentation for requirements and installation instructions.

docs.title: What is an instance?
docs.text:
Your podcast is hosted on your sever and connected to the fediverse in what is called an "instance". Your instance can manage multiple podcasts, people and users, and host additional pages found on all of your podcasts.

Managing your instance, including podcasts, people, and users is separate from the settings for each individual podcast.

docs.title: Ready to get started?
docs.text: Find out how to add your first podcast and create an episode in Get Started. Or visit the sections below to learn more about the different settings in your instance.

docs.title: Adding a podcast
docs.text: You can create a new podcast or import an existing podcast into Castopod in the Podcasts section.

docs.title: Import an existing podcast
docs.text:
Note

If your import times out, check your max_execution_time in your PHP.ini file. You may need to increase it from 30 seconds (the default) to add more time, such as 300 seconds (5 minutes) for larger podcasts.
